author: rcmorano [PEACE]
title: Dandelion: Cardano API market
description: There are too few professional deployments of Cardano API gateways. This limits the ability of light dApps and services to operate at scale.

assessments.note: This is a proposal very aligned with the DeFi challenge from a proven GimbaLabs team.

This proposal identifies a need for the developer community but doesn't directly address the challenge of generation of DeFi Dapps. This proposal would not only make DeFi development work easier but all Dapp development would be easier which means it could be a better fit elsewhere.
assessments.reply:
Although DeFi protocols built is one of the suggested KPIs to measure success on this callenge, Catalyst success definition is about, quoting literally: "building competitive environment for DeFi on Cardano with an emphasis on cross-collaboration & driving composability across protocols.".
We think a market of API services -which in addition, will imply the development of a DeFi protocol for subscriptions in layer 2 in the future- would help to make a solid ecosystem and encourage developers of critical DeFi solutions to build on Cardano.with an emphasis on cross-collaboration & driving composability across protocols.". We think a market of API services -which in addition, will imply the development of DeFi protocol for subscriptions in layer 2 in the future- would help to make a solid ecosystem and encourage builders of critical DeFi solutions to build on Cardano.

assessments.note: The proposal carefully lays out the existing problems, short-comings and bottlenecks in the Cardano development space and does an even better job at carefully explaining the solutions to the problems, including proposals within the same funding round which compliments this dev. Not pretending I understand all technical aspects presented, however, the clear explanation of the missing pieces of solid infrastructure  and the boot-strapping required to get projects going is a very familiar narrative to the Cardano Community who have been exposed to SPO and NFT chatter in media channels where ADA is discussed. This solution is a critical part of Cardano's developmental success once Alonzo is released.

This proposal is not a DeFi protocol, it's an API marketplace, this belongs in a dApp or developer ecosystem challenge not in a DeFi focused challenge. its also not at all how this makes Cardano DeFi protocols more competitive, when you look at the protocols that scale Etheruem DeFi sector, 0 of them are API marketplaces, instead they focus on derivatives, swaps, lending, insurance and automated trading strategies. 

Developers also only need 2 Cardano API's and Blockfrost to build a dApp

assessments.note: Great plan that would help DeFi projects get of the ground with lower technical effort thus accelerating deployment.

The problem described is reasonable and is in the scope of the challenge. DeFi dapps depend on API gateways and recently YOROI had problems due to excessive transaction load. Considering the fact that YOROI will be used in the interaction of users with different dapps on the blockchain, improving this infrastructure is an important step towards creating an efficient DeFi and blockchain ecosystem as a whole. Creating a market for APIs would allow better distribution of resources and network resilience to peak network usage, which would bring conditions for that DeFi dapps can run more smoothly on the blockchain.

The lack of clarity in deliverables makes it difficult to measure the impact.
It is a very important project for a working DeFi ecosystem in Cardano.
the project vision for Cardano API's, 3 month roadmap and presented plan are all complete and in line with the outlined deliverables.
The experience of the proposers in the Cardano ecosystem is vast, and this proposal builds on previous funding rounds.

Being presented by an ex-Emurgo DevOps person gives this proposal credibility and familiarity with the technicalities required to see the problems and achieve the goals. The proposal carefully lays out the required resources, the breakdown of roles and responsibilities and the renumeration for the time period of the work, which without being mentioned, seems to be in line with the release of Alonzo. The proposer also elaborated on existing network relationships and the leveraging of outside participants and activities which would be critical to this development. this not only provides confidence in the implementation but provides an almost internal-audit mechanism from any boot-strapping partners. The fund requested seems reasonable for the time and amount of work that needs to be done
Good plan by experience team. Highly likely to deliver.

The proposer described relevant experiences for the execution of the proposal and the idea is to continue the development of the Dandelion APIs. Although the proposer is known in the Cardano community, I think it is important that he put more details about his bio and links so that the community has access to his portfolio. and qualifications (Linkedin or repos).

There are details on budget allocation.

Some goals have been defined in the roadmap, but the solutions and deliverables described are not clear. The reputation model is clearly an item to be developed in the proposal, but the rest are unclear. There is a dependency on the proposal in another proposal submitted in the Metadata challenge: https: //cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/Blockchain-Authentication-Mechanism/352005-48088.

It is not clear whether a lack of funding in the above proposal could jeopardize development and this poses risks.

I recommend that you communicate more clearly what the purpose of each proposal is, the dependence between them and what the expectation of the project will be if only one of the proposals is funded.
The team seems to have the necessary experience to complete the project.
Ex-Emurgo DevOps Lead ; and the plan is detailed and realistic.
The proposal directly addresses the challenge and is well positioned to become the API gateway for all Cardano dApps.

This proposal provides a clean budget which may be audited however it doesn't provide a metric on which we could judge real adoption, such as a number of new API gateways developed, number of calls, number of Dandelion 'seeds' in use etc.

The proposal has the credibility and the information to provide the confidence that the goals can be achieved. It was very tactical to include all the projects 'familiar' to the Cardano Community which they have already assisted over the last few months. This serves as a good foundation of the experience, the know-how and the effectiveness of the solution. Despite the 5-star rating given, the proposal can be further improved by stating how the service plans to make itself sustainable.
Detailed plan and milestones make this simple to audit.

There is clarity on how the problem addresses the challenge.

There are details on budget allocation.

There is a roadmap with goals and the deadline for implementing the proposal is 3 months. There is no clarity in the deliverables, I recommend clarifying this aspect (This proposal is dependent on another proposal: https://cardano.ideascale.com/a/dtd/Blockchain-Authentication-Mechanism/352005-48088 and the deliverables between them are not clear )

I recommend including more details about the proposer's experience so that the community can audit this easily and transparently.
The proposal presents a destination for the funds and also a timetable for the project.
The roadmap mentions milestones which can be reviewed. But there are no quantitative objectives on this proposal.

solution: Build a market of API gateway deployments that serves as backbone for projects; specially for DeFi ones, whose criticality is high.
experience: DevOps advocate with over 15 years of experience. Ex-Emurgo DevOps Lead. Gimbalabs Co-Founder. Dandelion Founder and Operator.
